data.title: Charles Fan, CEO & CIO of JinYi Capital, on identifying investment opportunities & understanding the asset management landscape in China
data.meta_description: In this insightful fireside chat, Charles Fan, CEO and CIO of JinYi Capital, shared his expertise on identifying investment opportunitiesREAD MORE
data.text:
In this insightful fireside chat, Charles Fan, CEO and CIO of JinYi Capital, shared his expertise on identifying investment opportunities and understanding the asset management landscape in China. With 19 years of experience in the industry, Fan provided a comprehensive overview of the Chinese market, highlighting its unique features, opportunities, and challenges.

Key Takeaways

China’s investor base: The market is driven by a growing middle class, with a high concentration of wealth in real estate (70%) and low-risk products (20-30%).

Opportunities in China: Fan highlighted three areas of interest: mega-beta stock names with high dividend payouts, quant feeding strategies, and offshore bond markets issued by Chinese government-owned companies.

JinYi Capital’s approach: The company focuses on relative value, cash flow generation, and principle protection, with a maximum exposure of 20% per fund.

Benefits of being a mid-size fund manager: JinYi Capital’s size allows for agility and flexibility in responding to regulatory changes, while also providing a more focused investment approach.

Unique selling point: Charles Fan’s experience, knowledge, and position in the market, combined with JinYi Capital’s infrastructure and analytics setup, provide a competitive edge.

Outlook for China in 2024: Charles Fan expressed a positive outlook for the Chinese market in 2024, particularly in the areas of US-China rate spreads, ultra bond markets, and deleveraging stories.

Brand Building and Technology: Fan emphasized the importance of branding in the finance industry, particularly in China, where reputation risk is high. He also discussed the potential impact of technology on the industry, highlighting the need for finance professionals to adapt and evolve in response to AI advancements.

Conclusion: Charles Fan encouraged foreign investors to consider China, despite current challenges, citing the country’s large population, growing high net worth individuals, and complete industry supply chain as attractive features. He expressed his willingness to help form partnerships between foreign investors and reputable Chinese partners.
